comments:
Not sure this if this is an EclipseMonkey problem or a Buckminster problem, but posting here.  I follow the directions for installing the EclipseMonkey source given at http://www.eclipse.org/dash/monkey-help.php?key=source-code but cannot materialize.  When I click the "Resolve and Materialize" button as instructed, an error dialog pops up with the message given below (the error is also logged in the error log, from which the message and trace were reproduced).  I have Buckminster version 1.0.0.v20070129 with the cvs plugin built-in.

Message:
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: cvc-complex-type.2.4.a: Invalid content was found starting with element 'rm:site'. One of '{"http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":documentation, "http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":property, "http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":propertyElement, "http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":searchPath, "http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":locator, "http://www.eclipse.org/buckminster/RMap-1.0":redirect}' is expected.: http://www.eclipse.org/dash/monkey/monkey.rmap at line: 9 column: 26

Created an attachment (id=58385)
New .rmap file to fix issues with latest buckminster version 1.0.0.v20070205

I've attached a new version of the .rmap file that appears to work correctly with Buckminster 1.0.0.v20070205. In order to get tis to work, I downloaded monkey.cquery and monkey.rmap, modified .rmap, pointed .cquery to my new .rmap and ran Buckminster. Works locally on Windows XP SP2 with Eclipse 3.2.1
I just tried the whole process and it seems to work, so I'll close this as fixed.
